org.obapanel.jedis.interruptinglocks

Class JedisLock

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obapanel.jedis.interruptinglocks.JedisLock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, IJedisLock

    public class JedisLock
extends java.lang.Object
implements IJedisLock
    Class that will perform a lock based on Redis locks It is also closeable to be used in try-with-resources I do not recommend reuse a locked-and-unlocked JedisLock Should be thread-safe, I do not recomend using between thread s https://redis.io/topics/distlock

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String CLIENT_RESPONSE_OK 
      static java.lang.String UNLOCK_LUA_SCRIPT 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JedisLock(redis.clients.jedis.JedisPool jedisPool, java.lang.String name)
      Creates a Redis lock with a name This constructor makes the lock with no time limitations
      JedisLock(redis.clients.jedis.JedisPool jedisPool, java.lang.String name, java.lang.Long leaseTime, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Creates a Redis lock with a name

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Lock asConcurrentLock()
      Creates a java.util.concurrent.Lock instance of this lock The new instance is binded to this object A JedisLock with leaseTinme can not be a concurrent lock, an exception will be thrown if you try
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o) 
      redis.clients.jedis.JedisPool getJedisPool()
      JedisPool object used to lock
      long getLeaseMoment()
      Moment when the lock was captured in this object, -1 if no locked
      java.lang.Long getLeaseTime()
      Lease time of the lock, null if none If null, lock is locked until manually unlocked
      java.lang.String getName()
      Name of the lock.
      long getTimeLimit()
      System time until lock will be not valid, -1 if no locked
      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit getTimeUnit()
      Timeunit of leased time, null if none
      int hashCode() 
      boolean isLocked()
      Returns true if the lock is retained with this object If the time has expired, it will return false If the time has not expired or no lease time is set, it will check the lock value against redis
      void lock()
      Try to lock, sleeping while it tries Can NOT be interrupted
      void lockInterruptibly()
      Try to lock, sleeping while it tries Can be interrupted
      void setWaitCylce(int time, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit) 
      boolean tryLock()
      Attempts to get the lock, It will try one time and return
      boolean tryLockForAWhile(long time, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Tries to obtain lock for a time, if time is consumed and no lock obtained, the method desists and returns false This does NOT have anything to do with the lock lease time, if it has one
      void underLock(java.lang.Runnable task)
      Will execute the task between locking of this lock The steps are: obtain lock - execute task - free lock This is into a try-catch so close is mandatory, even after an exception This operation can be interrputed, and will wait to obtaint the lock This method will use and consume the lock
      <T> T underLock(java.util.function.Supplier<T> task)
      Will execute the task between locking and return the result The steps are: obtain lock - execute task - free lock - return result This is into a try-catch so close is mandatory, even after an exception This operation can be interrputed, and will wait to obtaint the lock
      void unlock()
      Attempts to unlock the lock

        clone, finalize, getClass, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        close

    • Constructor Detail

      • JedisLock

        public JedisLock(redis.clients.jedis.JedisPool jedisPool,
                 java.lang.String name)
        Creates a Redis lock with a name This constructor makes the lock with no time limitations
        Parameters:
        jedisPool - Jedis is Java Redis connection and operations pool
        name - Unique name of the lock, shared with all distributed lock

      • JedisLock

        public JedisLock(redis.clients.jedis.JedisPool jedisPool,
                 java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.Long leaseTime,
                 java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Creates a Redis lock with a name
        Parameters:
        jedisPool - Jedis is Java Redis connection and operations pool
        name - Unique name of the lock, shared with all distributed lock
        leaseTime - Amount of time in unit that the lock should live
        timeUnit - Unit of leaseTime

      • tryLockForAWhile

        public boolean tryLockForAWhile(long time,
                                java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: IJedisLock
        Tries to obtain lock for a time, if time is consumed and no lock obtained, the method desists and returns false This does NOT have anything to do with the lock lease time, if it has one
        Specified by:
        tryLockForAWhile in interface IJedisLock
        Parameters:
        time - Time to expend trying to obtain lock
        unit - Unit of the time
        Returns:
        true if lock obtained, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If someone interrputs the action

      • underLock

        public void underLock(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Description copied from interface: IJedisLock
        Will execute the task between locking of this lock The steps are: obtain lock - execute task - free lock This is into a try-catch so close is mandatory, even after an exception This operation can be interrputed, and will wait to obtaint the lock This method will use and consume the lock
        Specified by:
        underLock in interface IJedisLock
        Parameters:
        task - Task to execute

      • underLock

        public <T> T underLock(java.util.function.Supplier<T> task)
        Description copied from interface: IJedisLock
        Will execute the task between locking and return the result The steps are: obtain lock - execute task - free lock - return result This is into a try-catch so close is mandatory, even after an exception This operation can be interrputed, and will wait to obtaint the lock
        Specified by:
        underLock in interface IJedisLock
        Parameters:
        task - Task to execute with return type

      • asConcurrentLock

        public Lock asConcurrentLock()
        Creates a java.util.concurrent.Lock instance of this lock The new instance is binded to this object A JedisLock with leaseTinme can not be a concurrent lock, an exception will be thrown if you try
        Returns:
